title: Unpopular opinion: I hope volibear doesnt become meta
body: Because every fucking time I see him and he runs predator any lane he goes to is a guaranteed kill. Its fucking ridiculous and oppressive. So no, I'm not mad about his low win rate because hes so frustrating to deal with

I generally agree. As it is right now, volibear's stats suck balls so currently he can just get stat checked by the majority of the melee roster even if he gets to them. It's riot's way of keeping him in the dirt until a rework.

As someone who had fun playing Voli yeah, when hes meta its toxic as shit, you're an unstoppable dumptruck dropping loads of pain. He baaaaaaadly needs a rework to make him take skill instead of being a walking stat check. That said I reeally, really hope they don't go the direction they've been going with a lot of newer champ designs. Its fine to make a champ take some skill, but lets face it new players DO need something simple to learn on, and Voli was that for me to learn JG. It seems they are taking all the simple to play champions and reworking them to be more complex. Just because a champ is simple to learn doesn't mean they can't have depth or counterplay.

Let CertainlyT rework Volibear :V

On a more serious note, he did knock it out of the park with Warwick.

I'm not implying that you're doing it, I'm just venting my frustration from all the yasuo qq threads.
I think it has to do with play rates. If a champ has a lot of players, then they should have a lower win rate, while champs with lower player amounts tend to have higher win rates or something.

A Rioter actually addressed this poo t recently. Yasuo has a high play rate, but his player base is also really dedicated, enough that their collective experience keeps his winrate from being artificially lowered much.

In other words, when yasuo's winrate is bad, it's usually the champ and not the players.

I think the plan was for him to get a new kit at some point.  I wouldn't be opposed to keeping him usable, but he definitely shouldn't be kept at a competitive state right now.  He has one of those kits that is either too strong or too weak with very little middle ground.

Ashe.
As someone who plays a lot of mid lane ive never really dealt with ashe but I can assume its hell for literally any immobile tank trying to get to her, or run from

Ashe's slow is actually balanced, it's like 5% base.


It's not until she hits level 14-ish that it reaches 52%......and it only lasts a single second and needs to be constantly reapplied to not drop down to 20%, which is generally a really weak slow.


It's not really impressive at all, especially given that pretty much every single tank has a gap closer that is only a fairly short CD.

Only champs in the game that i can recall that get's bothered by Ashe's slow are probably Darius and Mordekaiser.

This is it almost exactly. It goes from 10% to 20% base tripling on crits. It's extremely fair because she has some of the lowest move speed and no move speed boosts at all. And Mord, Darius, Voli sometimes, and maybe maybe maybe someone like Udyr if he happens to be out of mana.

Ah that was a better way to put it, but i dunno about volibear, last ones i saw ran predator and just rushed through my slow before i could even fire a second shot.


But on another point, have you tried playing Ashe with approach velocity from inspiration? It gives move speed when going towards a target that you have CC'ed.

It is applied by your basic attacks with no CD.

It enhances her chasing and followup so i quite like it^^

You only give up attack speed for it, it's better than precision I think. I lose lane less with it. Plus her W always applies the triple slow so you can't really dodge comet.
